business.headline: Adani to supply clean energy for Google's cloud operations in IndiaThe renewable energy will come from a new solar-wind hybrid project located at Khavda, Gujarat, which is home to the world's largest renewable energy facility.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Motivated narrative: India rejects US Commission's religious freedom reportThe Ministry of External Affairs said the US report misrepresents facts about India and promotes a "motivated narrative."

Nagarjuna sues Telangana Minister over remarks on Samantha-Naga Chaitanya divorceVeteran actor Nagarjuna Akkineni has filed a complaint against Telangana Minister Konda Surekha over her derogatory comments on Samantha and Naga Chaitanya's divorce.

Haryana BJP leader's dramatic 'ghar wapsi' to Congress at Rahul Gandhi's rallyAshok Tanwar was campaigning for the BJP till around 1.45 pm today, as he tweeted in support of party candidate from Nalwa. Barely an hour later, he was seen sharing a stage with Congress leaders during his 'ghar wapsi'.

'Athletes can't blame anyone else for failing at weigh-in': Boxer Mary KomFormer India boxer MC Mary Kom said that weight management is the athlete's responsibility in the weight bound sports such as wrestling or boxing.

Cancer in your cake? Which cakes are safe to eat?The Karnataka Food Safety and Quality Department has issued a warning about cakes made in local bakeries that contain cancer-causing ingredients. No, you don't have to stop eating your favourite cake; you just need to be cautious.

Head of Hamas's government in Gaza among 3 killed in airstrikes, claims IsraelIn a social media post, the IDF claimed that a strike on an underground compound in northern Gaza killed Hamas's Gaza government head Rawhi Mushtaha and two other leaders. There was no immediate comment from Hamas.

Congress MLA's son, arrested in Rs 400 crore scam, seen roaming outside hospitalSikandar Singh, along with his father, is accused of defrauding over 1,500 home buyers and siphoning Rs 400 crore by booking fake construction expenditures in a real estate firm.

Kolkata rape-murder victim's statue unveiled at RG Kar hospital, sparks rowJunior doctors installed a statue of the trainee doctor who was raped and murdered at Kolkata's RG Kar hospital on August 9, in a move that has drawn massive backlash.

The surprising grit of tiny IsraelIsrael is a tiny country with one-third of Delhi's population that is surrounded with foes that question its existence. This is how Israel has managed to not just survive but fight wars on multiple fronts like it is doing now. This even as it converted desert land into farmland and turned foes into friends.

She faced significant backlash for her unsubstantiated claims.

Rohit Sharma unimpressed by Axar Patel's MS Dhoni imitation: Helicopter Ghuma NaIndian team captain Rohit Sharma was left unimpressed by Axar Patel's attempt at imitating MS Dhoni during the episode featuring the side on the Kapil Sharma show.

Video: Priyanka Mohan narrowly escapes as stage collapses during mall openingTamil-Telugu actor Priyanka Mohan had a narrow escape as the stage collapsed during the inauguration of Kasam Shopping Mall in Torrur, Telangana. Videos from the event are now doing the rounds on social media.

Iran, firing missiles at Israel now, worked with it on a missile projectIran fired around 200 missiles into Israel on October 1. It is interesting to note that Iran and Israel, now sworn enemies, had collaborated in the 1970s on 'Project Flower', which was aimed at developing surface-to-surface missiles. What more, the missiles were intended to be fitted with nuclear warheads.

Om Puri's wife Nandita recalls actor didn't have money to buy her a mangalsutraLate actor Om Puri's wife, Nandita Puri, recently shared that he was unable to afford a mangalsutra or wedding ring for her. Om Puri was previously married to Seema Kapoor.

Russia launches major drone attack on Ukraine, several buildings damagedThe Ukrainian Air Force said it had shot down 78 out of 105 Russian drones during the assault, with 23 more likely impacted by active electronic jamming.

Nasrallah agreed to ceasefire before he was killed by Israel: Lebanon ministerHassan Nasrallah, the Hezbollah chief who died in an Israeli airstrike last month, had agreed to a 21-day ceasefire with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu shortly before his death, according to Lebanon Foreign Minister Abdallah Bou Habib.

Men in Black set was cleared for 3 hours. Reason? Will Smith's fartHollywood star Will Smith is a 'farter,' Men in Black director Barry Sonnenfeld claimed in a recent interview. The filmmaker shared that the set had to evacuated for three long hours after Smith did the deed.

On Thursday, Younis was honoured with a special presentation at Adelaide Oval.

Who is Jafer Chohan: From dismissing Joe Root in nets to England call-upJafer Chohan is the latest spinner to make his debut in the England team as he continued his impressive run of form. Chohan was used as a net bowler by England during the Pakistan tour in 2022.

Shamar Joseph among 9 players to get historic multi-year West Indies contractCricket West Indies announced multi-year contracts for as many as nine players, including three from the senior women's team. Multi-year contracts have been handed to players for the first time in a bid to avoid more talent drain to franchise-based T20 leagues.

Messi scores insane free-kick as Inter Miami win Supporters' Shield in MLSLionel Messi scored a ridiculous free-kick to help Inter Miami win the Supporters' Shield in Major League Soccer on Wednesday, October 2. Messi scored a brace in the team's 3-2 win over Columbus Crew.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
